alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 15 at 4:48AM EST until January 17 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Kershaw, Lancaster and Fairfield Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. At 102.5 feet, Roadways near Beaver Creek become flooded. At 103.0 feet, Home owners on low lying property have to move belongings out of basements or from under raised houses. Boat launch on U.S. Highway 1 at the lake closed due to flood water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 102.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM EST Monday was 102.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening and continue falling to 93.1 feet Friday evening. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EST.
